E. Wilde: Course Summary

(2) Abstract

Q&A with a short discussion of the course topics, followed by questions about topics, standards, technologies, and exam issues.



E. Wilde: Course Summary

(3) Course Topics

  • XML Basics how to use them [XML Basics]
  • Describing classes of XML documents [Document Type Definition (DTD)]
  • Combining different vocabularies of XML documents [XML Namespaces]
  • Selecting parts of an XML document [XML Path Language (XPath)]
  • Transforming XML into something else (or XML again) [XML Transformations (XSLT) – Part I]
  • A more complicated way to describe classes of XML documents [XML Schema (XSD) – Part I]
  • Alternative ways of describing classes of XML documents [RELAX NG]
  • Querying XML with a dedicated query language [XML Query (XQuery) – Part I]
  • Managing XML in a dedicated XML database [Setting Up xDB]


E. Wilde: Course Summary

(4) Exam Format

  • Do not waste time and energy memorizing data
  • What matters is understanding and connecting concepts
  • You may be asked to comment on certain designs
  • You may be asked to propose certain designs
  • Which technology to choose for a certain problem?
  • The goal is to know what XML is and isn't good/useful for
